snippet: The Obama administration suspended military ties to Russia, including exercises, port visits and planning meetings, just a day after calling off trade talks.
abstract: United States prepares to impose sanctions on high-level Russian officials involved in military occupation of Crimea, as escalating crisis in Ukraine prompts turmoil in global markets; Obama administration suspends military ties to Russia, including exercises, port visits and planning meetings, just a day after calling off trade talks.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Steven Erlanger from Kiev, Ukraine; Liz Alderman and David Jolly from Paris; Stanley Reed from London; and Jonathan Weisman from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration suspended military ties to Russia, including exercises, port visits and planning meetings, just a day after calling off trade talks.

headline.main: Top Russians Face Sanctions by U.S. for Crimea Crisis
headline.print_headline: Top Russians Face Sanctions by U.S. for Crimea Crisis
